info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 9:56PM PDT until August 21 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until midnight PDT. * At 956 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across southern Clark County between Searchlight and Laughlin. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of washes and low water crossings as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Nipton Road Mile Marker 3, Cottonwood Cove and Laughlin. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
